result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Hicks

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Ronald Hicks
Current: UNKNOWN,   (Effective: 08-22-2022)
Prior: 2255 Burton Ave; APT #32, Beloit, WI 53511 United States
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture for the defendant returned.  Return to sender, not deliverable as addressed, unable to forward.

addressed to: Ronald Hicks for hearing on 8/11/22 
Return to Sender, Unable to Forward.
Return of Notice of Assignment of Judge addressed to defendant.

2:39 PM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald Hicks not in court. Court notes the matter was scheduled for 1:30 and it is not 2:39 p.m.  The defendant has not appeared, nor has he contacted the clerk's office.  Court also notes a capias was stayed until today's hearing from the last court date.  Court will issue the capias and orders bail be forfeited.

11:04 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Ronald Hicks not in court.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes matter was set for status of counsel at 10:30 and the defendant has failed to appear.  State requests a capias and bail be revoked and/or forfeited.  Court inquires if there are any other missed court appearances.  State advises this would be his first missed appearance.  Court will adjourn for status next week; if the defendant fails to appear at the next court date capias will issue.  Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

10:05 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Ronald Hicks in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires if the defendant will be proceeding pro se.  Defendant advises now, he thought someone was supposed to come evalute him while he was in custody but they did not.  Court advises the defendant he should report to the Public Defender's office today to be evaluated.  Court also provides the defendant with the petition for court appointed attorney, if he does not qualify.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ronald Hicks
Current: 2255 Burton Ave; APT #32, Beloit, WI 53511 United States  (Effective: 06-22-2022)
Prior: 917 Park Ave, Beloit, WI 53511
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Laura F. Lau on 05/20/2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:46 PM Defendant Ronald Hicks in court, in custody.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  The defendant was not evaluated by the Public Defenders Office as he gave them an incorrect name.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
